page.title: 12Farming
page.content: figure is a reduced output from the 3300 gallons they could produce before the E.E.C. rulings. Much of the land south of the main A12 is farmland too and it is owned by farms such as Mowden Hall Farm and Priory Farm. These farms mainly grow cereal crops like barley and wheat of which there are many different types and also rape and others. The area we live in is very good for arable farming because the land is flat and the earth is quite heavy, beneath the top layers of soil there is clay and gravel.
